author: Scott1
title: Good Idea, Mediocre Result
review:
Lego definitely had a good idea when they decided to make a standalone money transporter. Unfortunately, it seems like a lack of effort pulled this set down, as the money transporter, particularly the front end, was built very lazily and just looks wrong.

Box/Instructions

The box was pretty small, like a standard $12.99/$19.99 set. The instructions are fairly small as well.

Parts

A lot of useful parts are included, like money and gold tiles and gems. Other than that, there are lots of wheels and vehicle parts to build your own vehicle.

Minifigures

The minifigs are good, but another police officer would have been great. The criminal has a red dolly, which seems to be a common color; all the criminals in this wave have red vehicles. I would like more variation, however.

The build

The build was very short but still very enjoyable.

The completed model

Lego is getting more and more juniorized each year it seems. That really comes into play in the money transporter itself. The front end is absolutely hideous. Maybe it's based off a European truck that I'm unaware of, maybe I'm just nit-picking, but this design makes it looks like something straight out of 4 Juniors. This lack of effort is unexcusable. After seeing what can be done with cars and trucks, this thing is a total letdown. It can be easily rectified, but right out of the box, it just looks ugly. I earnestly hope Lego does not continue on this path of juniorization. They can put more resources into Juniors if they wish, but please, keep it out of City.
